newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Portuguese bonds recover after Greenspan.
newsitem.headline: Portuguese bonds recover after Greenspan.

text.p: Portuguese bonds closed slightly firmer after remarks by U.S. Fed Chairman Alan Greenspan led market operators to anticipate a 25 basis points U.S. rate rise, dealers said.
They said 10-year bond yields were unlikely to break through resistance of seven percent soon.
"If the market continues to anticipate a rise in U.S. rates of 25 basis points, this is already discounted in prices," one operator said.
Another said: "Ten year bond yields are facing strong resistance at seven percent."
